{{Infobox song | Name = Geni e o Zepelim | cover = | Type = | Artist = [[Chico Buarque]] | original_artist = | alt Artist = | recorded_by = | performed_by = | Album = [[Ópera do Malandro]] | A-side = | Recorded = 1978 | Released = {{Start date|1978}} | Published = | Genre = [[Música popular brasileira|MPB]] | Length = {{Duration|m=6|s=24}} | Writer = Chico Buarque | Composer = | Lyricist = | Language = [[Brazilian Portuguese]] | Form = | Label = | Producer = | ISWC = | Tracks = | prev = | prev_no = | track_no = | next = | next_no = | Misc = }} '''Geni e o Zepelim''' ([[English language|English]]: Geni and the Zeppelin) is a [[Brazil]]ian [[Música popular brasileira|MPB]] song, composed and recorded by [[Chico Buarque]] for his 1978 album [[Ópera do Malandro (álbum)|Ópera do Malandro]], the soundtrack to the [[Ópera do Malandro|eponymous musical play]], in which the song's plot is set; it is also part of its soundtrack. A [[:pt:Ópera do Malandro (filme)|film adaptation]] was released in 1986. The song has become relevant enough that the refrain "''joga pedra na Geni''" has been referenced in situations where people are victims of moral patrolling.{{cite web|url=http://www.migalhas.com.br/dePeso/16,MI129789,101048-Joga+pedra+na+Geni|title=Joga Pedra na Geni|publisher=Migalhas|author=Oliveira, Mário Oscar Chaves|date=30 March 2011|accessdate=30 November 2011}} == Composition == The [[lyrics]] are hepta-syllabic [[rhyme|rhyming]] [[verse (poetry)|verse]]s with strict [[metre (poetry)|meter]], and are about Geni, a [[transvestism|transvestite]] who was ostracized by the townspeople. After a [[zeppelin]] approaches the town and its pilot threatens to attack it, the ship's pilot demands Geni to sleep with him so he will spare the town, which she does. The populace temporarily treat Geni differently. The day after, she returns home and is immediately persecuted just as she was before.{{Cn|date=February 2017}} == Inspiration == Some sources suggest Geni could have been inspired by the homonymous character from [[Nelson Rodrigues]]'s 1965 play [[Toda Nudez Será Castigada]].{{cite web|url=http://criticaemcena.blogspot.com/2010/08/toda-nudez-sera-castigada.html|title=Toda Nudez Será Castigada|publisher=Crítica em Cena|accessdate=30 November 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://ged.feevale.br/bibvirtual/Monografia/MonografiaFernandaSantos.pdf |title=O Lar e As Ruas: A Dicotomia das Personagens Femininas na Dramaturgia de Nelson Rodrigues |author=Santos, Fernanda Marques |publisher=Centro Universitário Feevale |date=1 June 2007 |accessdate=30 November 2011 }}{{dead link|date=January 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} == Meaning == Various sources believe the song to be critical of [[colonialism]], [[imperialism]] and [[capitalism]], and that Geni is a personification of the [[oppression|oppressed]] groups and peoples.{{cite web|url=http://www4.pucsp.br/pos/lael/lael-inf/teses/FranciscusWiel.pdf |title=Trabalho e Malandragem como Repressão e Transgressão nas Canções da Ópera do Malandro de Chico Buarque |author=Wiel, Franciscus Willem Antonius Maria Van de |publisher=PUC-SP |accessdate=1 December 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131113192247/http://www4.pucsp.br/pos/lael/lael-inf/teses/FranciscusWiel.pdf |archivedate=13 November 2013 |df= }} João Marcos Mateus Kogawa, of Revista Urutágua wrote about "Geni e o Zepelim":
Geni symbolizes silence, submission and non-voice, in the context of a system which prevents her from talking. Nevertheless, her other ''subject'' talks through the voice of the author, who portrays her as a martyr or [[hero]]ine, who attacks her inquisitors' values.{{cite web|url=http://www.urutagua.uem.br/010/10kogawa.htm|title=Geni no Entremeio de Uma Arena de Vozes|author=Kogawa, João Marcos Mateus|date=2006-01-01|publisher=Revista Urutágua|accessdate=30 November 2011}}

'''The Great All American Youth Circus''', also known as '''The Great Y Circus''', is billed as the oldest community circus in the world and is located in [[Redlands, California]], [[United States]].
== History == Founded in 1929 by YMCA Director Roy Coble, a former [[Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus|Ringling Brothers Barnum & Bailey]] performer, the Great Y Circus is a unique tradition in Redlands, California. Billed as the oldest community circus in the world, it is one of only a handful of programs like it in the United States. The Great Y Circus started small and has grown tremendously throughout the years. The only years it was dark were from 1943-1948 (during the war) and in 1987-1988 (when the YMCA was without the insurance coverage required and continuation of the circus was in doubt).
Each year, approximately 300 performers of all ages (from 20 months and up) learn circus skills in classes that are held at the YMCA from September through April. The circus features performances such as juggling, trapeze, rings, lear, unicycles, acrobats, and teeterboard. Many youth who participate stay in the program for many years, and some alumni have gone on to jobs in professional entertainment industries as stunt performers and circus performers. A few of the performers are even 4th generation performers in this circus.
Small community outreach performances are given throughout the year for a variety of audiences, and the main end-of-season show is held on the first three weekends of May in the Coble Gym at the Redlands YMCA.
Currently, the circus is co-sponsored by the Redlands YMCA and the non-profit Community Circus Arts Corporation. It is managed by a few YMCA staff members and a very large group of volunteers that include trainers, facilitators, and assistants.

revision.text:
{{Infobox book | italic title = | name = Grey: Fifty Shades of Grey As Told by Christian | image = File:Grey Fifty Shades of Grey As Told by Christian.jpg | image_size = | alt = | caption = | author = [[E. L. James]] | audio_read_by = | title_orig = | orig_lang_code = | title_working = | translator = | illustrator = | cover_artist = | country = United Kingdom | language = English | series = [[Fifty Shades trilogy|''Fifty Shades'' trilogy]] | release_number = | subject = | genre = [[erotic romance novels|Erotic romance]] | set_in = | published = 18 June 2015 | publisher = Vintage | publisher2 = | pub_date = | english_pub_date = | media_type = Print, e-book, audiobook | pages = 576 pages | awards = | isbn = 1101946342 | isbn_note = | oclc = | dewey = | congress = | preceded_by = [[Fifty Shades Freed]] | followed_by = [[Darker: Fifty Shades Darker as Told by Christian|Darker]] | native_wikisource = | wikisource = | notes = | exclude_cover = | website = }}
'''''Grey: Fifty Shades of Grey As Told by Christian''''', also referred to as '''''Grey''''', is a 2015 [[erotic romance novels|erotic romance]] by British author [[E. L. James]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Italie|first1=Leanne|title=New EL James 'Fifty Shades' book isn't kinky Christian Grey's first time as narrator|url=http://www.vancouversun.com/entertainment/James+Fifty+Shades+book+isnt+kinky+Christian+Greys+first/11109136/story.html|publisher=Vancouver Sun|accessdate=14 June 2015}}</ref> It is the fourth installment in the [[Fifty Shades trilogy|''Fifty Shades'' series]], which had its start as [[fanfiction]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Morris|first1=Linda|title=E. L. James' latest Fifty Shades of Grey novel stolen|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/entertainment/books/69297793/e-l-james-latest-fifty-shades-of-grey-novel-stolen|publisher=Stuff.co.nz|accessdate=14 June 2015}}</ref>
The novel was released on 18 June 2015 to coincide with the birth date of the character Christian Grey. The work's first printing run consisted of 1.25 million copies.<ref name="deadline">{{cite web|last1=Jaafar|first1=Ali|title=E.L. James To Publish Another Shade Of ‘Grey’ In June|url=http://deadline.com/2015/06/grey-el-james-new-book-publish-june-18-1201435503/|website=Deadline|publisher=Deadline|accessdate=June 1, 2015|date=June 1, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Deahl|first1=Rachel|title=Summer Blockbuster Book Battle: Harper Lee vs. E.L. James|url=http://www.publishersweekly.com/pw/by-topic/new-titles/adult-announcements/article/67132-coming-soon-harper-lee-vs-e-l-james.html|publisher=Publishers Weekly|accessdate=14 June 2015}}</ref>
==Summary== Christian Grey, a successful and rich 27-year-old businessman, meets 21-year-old university student Anastasia "Ana" Steele when she interviews him on behalf of her friend/roommate Katherine "Kate" Kavanagh (being sick with the flu at the time) for the university newspaper. The characters develop an attraction for each other and Christian proposes a [[BDSM|sadomasochistic]] relationship with Ana.
Christian hopes that his relationship with Ana will relieve the effects of a traumatic childhood, but his dark sexual proclivities and self-loathing drive Ana away. Ana is initially naive about Christian's sadism and the power dynamics in their relationship but as the novel progresses she comes to understand that his behaviour is cold and controlling.
==Development== On 1 June 2015 James announced that she was in the process of writing another book in the ''Fifty Shades'' series due to popular demand from her fanbase.<ref>{{cite web|title=Publisher unfazed by Grey theft|url=http://www.cotswoldjournal.co.uk/news/national/13323657.Publisher_unfazed_by_Grey_theft/|publisher=Cotswold Journal|accessdate=14 June 2015}}</ref> Later that same day she posted an image on her [[Instagram]] account that confirmed that the novel would be titled ''Grey'', that it would be told from the perspective of Christian Grey, and that she had deliberately chosen its publication date in order to coincide with Grey's birthday.<ref>{{cite web|title=EL James whips out new 'Grey'|url=http://www.timeslive.co.za/thetimes/2015/06/05/EL-James-whips-out-new-Grey|publisher=Times Live|accessdate=14 June 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Fowler|first1=Tara|title=E L James Announces New Fifty Shades of Grey Book Told from Christian's Perspective|url=http://www.people.com/article/fifty-shades-of-grey-el-james-new-book-christian-perspective|publisher=People|accessdate=14 June 2015}}</ref> Pre-order sales for ''Grey'' have been extremely strong, which led many retailers to order large quantities of the book in order to meet release day demand.<ref name=TG>{{cite web|last1=Addley|first1=Esther|title=Fourth Fifty Shades book whips up unprecedented pre-ordering frenzy|url=https://www.theguardian.com/books/2015/jun/12/fourth-fifty-shades-book-whips-up-unprecedented-pre-ordering-frenzy|publisher=The Guardian|accessdate=14 June 2015}}</ref> An editor for ''[[The Bookseller]]'' also commented that ''Grey'' could become the "biggest book of the year".<ref name=TG />
On 11 June 2015 [[Random House]] reported that a finished copy of ''Grey'' had been stolen and that the theft was being investigated by Kent police.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Jones|first1=Nate|title=E.L. James’s Christian Grey Manuscript Stolen by Person With Singular Tastes|url=http://www.vulture.com/2015/06/el-jamess-christian-grey-manuscript-stolen.html|publisher=Vulture|accessdate=14 June 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Sims|first1=Andrew|title=‘Grey’ pulls a ‘Midnight Sun': Copy of new ‘Fifty Shades’ book disappears|url=http://www.hypable.com/fifty-shades-grey-book-leak/|publisher=Hypable|accessdate=14 June 2015}}</ref> The theft, which occurred on 8 June,<ref>{{cite web|last1=Ward|first1=Victoria|title=Mystery surrounds theft of new Fifty Shades of Grey manuscript|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newstopics/howaboutthat/11664189/Mystery-surrounds-theft-of-new-Fifty-Shades-of-Grey-manuscript.html|publisher=Telegraph|accessdate=14 June 2015}}</ref> has been compared to the 2008 leak of [[Stephenie Meyer|Stephenie Meyer's]] ''[[Midnight Sun (Meyer novel)|Midnight Sun]]'', an unreleased companion novel that retells the events of ''Twilight'' from the perspective of Edward Cullen.<ref name=theft>{{cite web|last1=Flood|first1=Alison|title=New Fifty Shades of Grey book stolen ahead of publication|url=https://www.theguardian.com/books/booksblog/2015/jun/10/new-fifty-shades-of-grey-book-stolen-ahead-of-publication|publisher=The Guardian|accessdate=14 June 2015}}</ref> Whereas the leak of ''Midnight Sun'' caused Meyer to put the work on indefinite hold, James stated that ''Grey'' would be released as scheduled.<ref name=theft />
==Reception==
===Press=== Critical reception for ''Grey'' has been generally negative and many critics have criticized it for being too similar to ''[[Fifty Shades of Grey]]''.<ref>{{cite web|last1=BIEDENHARN|first1=ISABELLA|title=Review Roundup: Christian Grey is a predictable psychopath in E.L. James' 'Grey'|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2015/06/18/grey-reviews-el-james|publisher=Entertainment Weekly|accessdate=20 June 2015}}</ref> The ''[[Daily Mail]]'s'' reviewer commented that "Ms James has simply shadowed the whole plot of Book One, reproducing the clunky polystyrene dialogue word for word, and inserting italicised thoughts by Christian himself."<ref>{{cite web|title=The reviews of Grey are in and they've knocked Fifty Shades out of it|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3131183/New-Fifty-Shades-book-Grey-reviews.html|accessdate=18 June 2015}}</ref> ''[[The Independent]]'' criticized the book and the choice to include Grey's internal monologues, stating that he had a "vacuous mental life" and that "The effect is increasingly comical – [[Mills & Boon]] meets ''[[Peep Show (TV series)|Peep Show]]'' – while the rest of his internal monologue is spent stating the bleeding obvious."<ref>{{cite web|last1=Clark|first1=Nick|title=Grey by E L James, review: There's plenty of graphic sex, but Fifty Shades sequel fails to excite|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/books/reviews/grey-e-l-james-book-review-lots-of-in-and-out-but-fifty-shades-sequel-fails-to-excite-10330195.html|publisher=Independent|accessdate=20 June 2015}}</ref> ''[[The Daily Telegraph|The Telegraph]]'' wrote a scathing review where they called it "as sexy as a misery memoir and as arousing as the diary of a sex offender" and wrote "It’s hard to work out what Ms Steele sees in him – even if you try to imagine him as [[Jamie Dornan]], it’s Jamie Dornan as the serial killer in ''[[The Fall (TV series)|The Fall]].''<ref>{{cite web|last1=Gordon|first1=Bryony|title=Mr Darcy with nipple clamps': Bryony Gordon reviews EL James's Grey|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/books/bookreviews/11683078/Mr-Darcy-with-nipple-clamps-Bryony-Gordon-reviews-EL-Jamess-Grey.html|publisher=Telegraph|accessdate=20 June 2015}}</ref> ''[[The Guardian]]'' remarked on the book, stating that while the first book was "a rather fun and fairly mild portrait of a woman’s sexual fantasy", that "Instead of lighthearted and repetitive mild S&M, the "love affair" is now the twisted work of an utter psychopath."<ref>{{cite web|last1=Colgan|first1=Jenny|title=Grey by EL James review – Christian Grey indulges his inner psychopath|url=https://www.theguardian.com/books/2015/jun/18/grey-by-el-james-review-fifty-shades-of-grey-follow-up|publisher=Guardian|accessdate=20 June 2015}}</ref> In the US, ''[[The Washington Post]]'' also found little of the original series in the rewrite: "Where Ana had bizarre quirks, a perplexing "inner goddess" who was an Olympic-caliber backflipper, and a general sense of naive wonder that lightened "Fifty Shades" and reminded readers not to take the story too seriously, there is none of that here. "Grey" is dark and unrelenting and far too serious, like Mr. Grey." <ref>{{cite web|last1=MacLean|first1=Sarah|title=Grey: Fifty Shades of Grey as Told by Christian is for fans only|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/entertainment/books/grey-fifty-shades-of-grey-as-told-by-christian-by-el-james/2015/06/18/b1f6f83a-1465-11e5-9518-f9e0a8959f32_story.html|publisher=Washington Post|accessdate=30 June 2015}}</ref>
===Audience=== Fan reception for ''Grey'' has been positive and the book sold over 1 million copies in its first week of release.<ref>{{cite web|title=EL James spends 'Grey' day with New York City fans|url=https://news.yahoo.com/el-james-spends-grey-day-york-city-fans-195327546.html|publisher=Yahoo|accessdate=20 June 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150620140114/https://news.yahoo.com/el-james-spends-grey-day-york-city-fans-195327546.html|archivedate=20 June 2015|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Grey: Fifty Shades' E L James whips fans into a frenzy with new erotic novel - updates and reaction|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/grey-read-live-fifty-shades-5899770|publisher=Mirror|accessdate=20 June 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Deahl|first1=Rachel|title=After First Weekend, E.L. James's 'Grey' Sells over 1 Million Copies|url=http://www.publishersweekly.com/pw/by-topic/industry-news/publisher-news/article/67219-after-first-weekend-e-l-james-s-grey-sells-over-1-million-copies.html|publisher=Publishers Weekly|accessdate=23 June 2015}}</ref>

{{Infobox television | show_name = Happyland | image = | caption = | genre = [[Comedy]] | creator = Ben Epstein | developer = | writer = | director = | starring = {{Plain list | * [[Bianca A. Santos]] * [[Camille Guaty]] * [[Shane Harper]] * Cameron Moulene * [[Katherine McNamara]] * [[Ryan Rottman]] }} | narrated = | theme_music_composer = | opentheme = | endtheme = | composer = | country = United States | language = English | num_seasons = 1 | num_episodes = 8 | executive_producer = {{Plain list | * Jill Cargermanhttps://www.imdb.com/name/nm0137075/ * [[Craig Zadan]] * [[Neil Meron]] }} | editor = | location = | cinematography = | camera = [[Single-camera setup|Single-camera]] | runtime = 22 minutes | company = Storyline Entertainment | distributor = | channel = [[MTV]] | picture_format = | audio_format = | first_run = | first_aired = {{dts|September 30}} | last_aired = {{End date|2014|11|18}} | preceded_by = | followed_by = | related = | website = https://www.mtv.com/shows/happyland/ | website_title = Official website | production_website = }} '''''Happyland''''' was an American comedy television series created by Ben Epstein. The series aired for one eight-episode season from September 30 through November 18, 2014, on [[MTV]].{{cite web|url=http://thefutoncritic.com/video/2014/09/16/video-tuesdays-are-getting-a-little-happier-when-mtvs-new-series-happyland-premieres-on-september-30-at-1100-pm-et-pt-833411/20140916mtv01/|title=Video: Tuesday's Are Getting a Little Happier When MTV's New Series "Happyland" Premieres on September 30 at 11:00 PM ET/PT|work=The Futon Critic|date=September 16, 2014|accessdate=September 29, 2014}}{{cite web |url= http://deadline.com/2013/10/mtv-picks-up-comedy-pilots-happyland-faking-it-to-series-615627/ |title= MTV Picks Up Comedy Pilots ‘Happyland’ & ‘Faking It’ To Series |last= Andreeva |first= Nellie |work= Deadline.com |date= October 18, 2013 |accessdate= September 30, 2014}} On January 8, 2015, [[MTV]] officially cancelled the series.http://insidetv.ew.com/2015/01/08/mtv-cancels-happyland-after-one-season/ ==Plot== ''Happyland'' follows the reality of the park workers of one of the most popular theme parks in America. The series centers on Lucy, the cynical daughter of the park's Princess Adriana, who, after deciding that she wants to leave the park and experience something real, is swept off her feet by the new park owner's son, Ian, not knowing that Ian is one of her half brothers and the park owner is her real dad. ==Cast== ;Main cast * [[Bianca A. Santos]] as Lucy Velez, is the secret love child of Elena Velez and James Chandler, who was raised by her single mother and not knowing who her dad is. When she first kisses Ian, her mother interrupts them and reveals that Ian is her brother, also revealing that her dad is James Chandler. When she and Ian are partnered together as Princess Adriana and Prince Valor, she freaks out when they have to kiss and tells him that they are siblings. Soon after they discover that they are not siblings and kiss again. * [[Camille Guaty]] as Elena Velez, is the mother of Lucy and has been working in Happyland amusement park for 20 years as Princess Adriana. When she was in her late teens she had a fling with James Chandler and became pregnant with Lucy. After he discovered the pregnancy he left for New York with his family, leaving Elena to be a single mother. She kept the identity of Lucy's dad a secret. * [[Shane Harper]] as Ian Chandler, is the son of James Chandler and brother of Theodore. Ian first meets Lucy when he is high inside the Ricky Raccoon costume and faints on stage. When Ian and Lucy are doing a scene together, she reveals to him that they are brother and sister. Later they discover they are not brother and sister. He is also a Love Child. * [[Ryan Rottman]] as Theodore "Theo" Chandler, is the son of James Chandler and older brother of Ian and Lucy. Theodore works in the Happyland executive department under his father. He is also unaware that he is related to Lucy. * [[Katherine McNamara]] as Harper Munroe, is Lucy's friend and Will's girlfriend. She is insecure about her relationship with Will because she believes he is in love with Lucy. *[[Cameron Moulène|Cameron Moulene]] as Will Armstrong, is Lucy's best friend and Harper's boyfriend. He is possibly in love with Lucy but can't admit it. When he meets Ian he becomes jealous of his relationship with Lucy and acts out. ;Recurring cast *[[Brady Smith (actor)|Brady Smith]] as James Chandler, owner of Happyland. He is the father of Theodore, Ian, and Lucy. He is involved with Elena, although he is married to Margot Chandler. *[[Chris Sheffield]] as Noah Watson. He is a college intern at Happyland and dated Lucy for a short while before she found out that he was cheating on her. *[[Josh Groban]] as "Dirty" Dave, a Happyland bartender. He is a long-time employee and therefore knows a lot about the people that come and out of the park. *[[Danielle Bisutti]] as Margot Chandler, the wife of James Chandler and the mother of Theodore and Ian. She is unaware of James and Elena's affair, although she might have some secrets of her own. ==Episodes== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="background:#FF6600; color:#fff; width:6%;"| No. ! scope="col" style="background:#FF6600; color:#fff; width:20%;"| Title ! scope="col" style="background:#FF6600; color:#fff; width:20%;"| Directed by ! scope="col" style="background:#FF6600; color:#fff; width:20%;"| Written by ! scope="col" style="background:#FF6600; color:#fff; width:20%;"| Original air date ! scope="col" style="background:#FF6600; color:#fff; width:14%;"| U.S. viewers
(millions) |- {{Episode list | EpisodeNumber = 1 | Title = Pilot | DirectedBy = [[Lee Toland Krieger]] | WrittenBy = Ben Epstein | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2014|9|30}} | Viewers = 0.42{{cite web|url=http://headlineplanet.com/home/2014/10/01/ratings-mtvs-happyland-attracts-423k-viewers/|title=Ratings: MTV's "Happyland" Attracts 423K Viewers|work=Headline Planet|accessdate=13 October 2014}} | ShortSummary = Lucy is on a quest to get away from the park's manufactured happiness and be part of something real. Elena reveals a secret to Lucy. | LineColor = FF6600 }} {{Episode list | EpisodeNumber = 2 | Title = Price of Admission | DirectedBy = Ryan Shiraki | WrittenBy = Jill Cargerman | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2014|10|7}} | Viewers = 0.43{{cite web|url=http://headlineplanet.com/home/2014/10/08/ratings-happyland-viewership-rises-week-two/|title=Ratings: "Happyland" Viewership Rises in Week Two|work=Headline Planet|accessdate=13 October 2014}} | ShortSummary = A house party within Dazzle (the Happyland owned town) brings a new flirtation in the form of a college intern and a fight with Harper that leaves Lucy reeling. | LineColor = FF6600 }} {{Episode list | EpisodeNumber = 3 | Title = Never Break Character | DirectedBy = [[Peter Lauer]] | WrittenBy = Ben Epstein | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2014|10|14}} | Viewers = 0.35{{cite web|url=http://headlineplanet.com/home/2014/10/15/ratings-happyland-viewership-falls-19-faking-also/|title=Ratings: "Happyland" Viewership Falls 19%; "Faking It" Also Down |work=Headline Planet|accessdate=October 17, 2014}} | ShortSummary = Lucy and Ian must pass character training together to continue getting paid, and with a looming eviction Lucy is highly motivated. Meanwhile, Lucy plans to go on a trip with Noah to visit his college. However after Will and Ian find out what kinda of guy Noah is, they convince Lucy that she doesn't need to go off with him. | LineColor = FF6600 }} {{Episode list | EpisodeNumber = 7 | Title = Leave of Absence | DirectedBy = David Katzenberg | WrittenBy = Jill Cargerman | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2014|11|11}} | Viewers = 0.35{{cite web|url=http://headlineplanet.com/home/2014/11/12/ratings-happyland-viewership-slides-despite-huge-faking-boost/|title=Ratings: "Happyland" Viewership Slides Despite Huge "Faking It" Boost |work=Headline Planet|accessdate=November 12, 2014}} | ShortSummary = Elena and James started to become romantic once again but when an unexpected guest at a wedding it happens to turn out to being James' wife. Will and Lucy began dating until Theo figures out Lucy's secret and attempts to rid Lucy and Elena of his father. | LineColor = FF6600 }} {{Episode list | EpisodeNumber = 8 | Title = Your Happyland Family | DirectedBy = David Katzenberg | WrittenBy = Ben Epstein | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2014|11|18}} | Viewers = 0.40{{cite web|url=http://headlineplanet.com/home/2014/11/19/ratings-happyland-viewership-rises-season-finale/|title=Ratings: "Happyland" Viewership Rises for Season Finale |work=Headline Planet|accessdate=November 19, 2014}} | ShortSummary = Lucy finds out that Ian might not actually be her brother and doesn't know if she should share the news. When James shows up to Elena and Lucy's place one night, he figures out the truth about Lucy. Later, it is revealed that Theodore had always known that Ian wasn't a real Chandler and Ian is furious. Lucy and Ian's feelings re-emerge and Will and Harper walk in on them making out. | LineColor = FF6600 }} |} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{IMDb title|3168978}} {{MTVNetwork Shows}} [[Category:2010s American comedy television series]] [[Category:2014 American television series debuts]] [[Category:2014 American television series endings]] [[Category:English-language television programs]] [[Category:MTV television series]] [[Category:Incest in television]] [[Category:Amusement parks in fiction]]

{{Redirect|Mirror maze|the Spanish film|Proyecto Dos}} {{Refimprove|date=December 2012}} [[File:Větruše, zrcadlové bludiště.jpg|thumb|right|250px|A house of mirrors in the Czech Republic]] A '''house of mirrors''' or '''hall of mirrors''' is a traditional attraction at [[funfair]]s (carnivals) and [[amusement park]]s. The basic concept behind a house of mirrors is to be a [[maze]]-like puzzle.<ref>{{cite web|last=Styer|first=Joel|title=Funhouse at Jenkinson's Beach Boardwalk|url=http://www.dafe.org/articles/funHouses/funhouse.html|publisher=Darkride and Funhouse Enthusiasts|accessdate=17 December 2012}}</ref> In addition to the maze, participants are also given mirrors as obstacles, and glass panes to parts of the maze they cannot yet get to. Sometimes the mirrors may be distorted because of different curves, [[wiktionary:convex|convex]], or [[wiktionary:concave|concave]] in the glass to give the participants unusual and confusing reflections of themselves, some humorous and others frightening.
== References in fiction ==
=== Literary === The first known literary example is in [[Gaston Leroux]]'s novel ''[[The Phantom of the Opera]]'' (1911), in which [[Erik (The Phantom of the Opera)|Erik]] has built one for the Shah of Persia as a trap and later uses a similar trap to protect his lair from his enemies. Perhaps the first cinematic instance of this was at the climax of the film ''[[The Lady from Shanghai]]'' (1948). Other notable examples include [[Woody Allen]]'s movie ''[[Manhattan Murder Mystery]]'' (1993) which directly refers to ''The Lady from Shanghai''; the CBS soap ''[[Guiding Light]]'' which, in 1980, featured a now famous sequence that depicted heroine [[Rita Stapleton|Rita Bauer]] ([[Lenore Kasdorf]]) being pursued through a hall of mirrors by villain Roger Thorpe ([[Michael Zaslow]]); the show ''[[Macgyver]]'', where Jack Dalton is brainwashed and is forced to fire on Macgyver; and ''[[Teen Titans (TV series)|the Teen Titans series]]'' episode "Betrayal". [[Francisco Scaramanga]]'s "Fun House" in the [[James Bond]] film ''[[The Man with the Golden Gun (film)|The Man with the Golden Gun]]'' has a House of mirrors. In an episode of the Twilight Zone, "[[In Praise of Pip]]", a bookie tries to tell his dying son how much he loves him while chasing him inside a house of mirrors; the 1984 movie [[Conan the Destroyer]] with [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] contains a house of mirrors fight, and the 1983 [[Walt Disney]] movie ''[[Something Wicked This Way Comes (film)|Something Wicked This Way Comes]]'' (an adaptation of [[Ray Bradbury]]'s [[Something Wicked This Way Comes (novel)|novel of the same title]]) culminates in a house of mirrors confrontation. In the fourth season of the show [[Leverage (TV series)|Leverage]], in the episode "The Carnival Job", Elliot has a showdown with Molly's captors in a house of mirrors.
The concept has also been used in comics. In ''[[Batman: The Dark Knight Returns]]'', [[Batman]] is seen chasing the [[Joker (comics)|Joker]] through an amusement park and into a hall of mirrors. It was used to create suspense as Joker could not clearly decipher what was real and what was just an image.
=== Film ===
In Charlie Chaplin's 1928 movie [[The_Circus_(film)|The Circus]], [[Charlie Chaplin]] is chased into a mirror maze by a thief and the police. [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G09dfRrUxUM Charlie Chaplin Official Youtube Movie Clip: Charlie Chaplin - The Mirror Maze (The Circus)]
In John Boorman's 1974 movie ''[[Zardoz]]'', character "Z" ([[Sean Connery]]) battles against "The Vortex" in a mirror maze.
One of the most famous ending sequences in film history related to a house of mirrors is in ''[[Enter the Dragon]]'' starring [[Bruce Lee]]. The finale takes place in a house of mirrors, where Lee learns it is best to smash the glass obstacles to solve his problem and defeat the villain.
''[[John Wick: Chapter 2]]'' (2017) - John Wick ([[Keanu Reeves]]) engages in a chase, gunfight, and climactic knife fight in a multi-floor modern art museum exhibit called "Reflections of the Soul" made of halls, rooms, and stairways lined with mirrors with lights and video screens reflected in them.
=== Music === The [[Kraftwerk]] album ''[[Trans-Europe Express (album)|Trans-Europe Express]]'' includes a song called "The Hall of Mirrors". Fusion guitarist [[Allan Holdsworth]] also has a song called "House of Mirrors" of his ''[[Hard Hat Area]]'' album. The [[Insane Clown Posse]] album ''[[Ringmaster (album)|The Ringmaster]]'' has a song called "House of Mirrors", representing it as one of the attractions of the [[Dark Carnival (Insane Clown Posse)|Dark Carnival]].
== History == The origins of the house of mirrors stem from the hall of mirrors in the [[Palace of Versailles]].
Upon a visit to France to discuss colonial land agreements, [[Peter Stuyvesant]] arrived at the Palace of Versailles and gazed upon the hall of mirrors present in the palace. Peter (or Petris) became determined to bring this amazement to the newly founded colonial city of [[New Amsterdam]], of which he was governor. Peter Stuyvesant's House of Mirrors was founded in 1651 and he charged one [[Dutch gulden]] for admission.
==See also== * [[Curved mirror]] * [[List of amusement rides]]

United States: United Artists</ref> <ref>{{cite web |last1=Chaplin |first1=Charlie |title=Filming The Circus |url=https://www.charliechaplin.com/en/biography/articles/1-The-Circus |website=Charlie Chaplin |publisher=Charlie Chaplin |accessdate=14 June 2018}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web |last1=Chaplin |first1=Charlie |title=Charlie Chaplin: The Mirror Maze (The Circus) |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G09dfRrUxUM |website=Charlie Chaplin Official |publisher=Youtube}}</ref>

{{Infobox organization | name = International Association for the Study of Popular Music | native_name = | native_name_lang = | named_after = | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | map = | map_size = | map_alt = | map_caption = | map2 = | map2_size = | map2_alt = | map2_caption = | abbreviation = IASPM | motto = | predecessor = | merged = | successor = | formation = September 1981 | founders = [[Charles Hamm]]
[[Simon Frith]] | founding_location = | extinction = | merger = | type = [[Learned society]] | status = | purpose = Advancing the academic study of [[popular music]] | professional_title = | headquarters = Institute of Popular Music at the [[University of Liverpool]], [[Liverpool]], [[England]] | location = | coords = | region = | services = | membership = | membership_year = | language = | sec_gen = | leader_title = Chair | leader_name = Goffredo Plastino | leader_title2 = General secretary | leader_name2 = Sue Miller | leader_title3 = | leader_name3 = | leader_title4 = | leader_name4 = | board_of_directors = | key_people = | main_organ = | parent_organization = | subsidiaries = | secessions = | affiliations = | budget = | budget_year = | staff = | staff_year = | volunteers = | volunteers_year = | slogan = | website = {{url|http://www.iaspm.net}} | remarks = | formerly = | footnotes = }} The '''International Association for the Study of Popular Music''' (abbreviated '''IASPM''') is an international [[learned society]] dedicated to the scholarly study of [[popular music]]. It was established in September 1981, with [[Charles Hamm]] and [[Simon Frith]] as two of its founding members.{{Cite web |url=https://www.uia.org/s/or/en/1100031554 |title=International Association for the Study of Popular Music (IASPM) |website=Open Yearbook|publisher=Union of International Associations}}{{Cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/10/24/arts/music/charles-hamm-author-on-american-popular-music-dies-at-86.html |title=Charles Hamm, Author on American Popular Music, Dies at 86 |last=Woolfe |first=Zachary |date=2011-10-23 |website=The New York Times |language=en-US |access-date=2017-07-10}}{{Cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2008/feb/06/britishidentity.musicnews |title=Hear where you're coming from |last=Barton |first=Laura |date=2008-02-06 |website=The Guardian |language=en-GB |access-date=2017-08-18}} By 1988, it had members in over 30 countries.{{Cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1988/10/02/arts/examining-pop-music-in-the-greater-sociological-context.html |title=Examining Pop Music in the Greater Sociological Context |last=Times |first=Jon Pareles, Special To The New York |date=1988-10-02 |website=The New York Times |language=en-US |access-date=2017-07-10}} Since 2002, its official headquarters has been at the [[University of Liverpool]]'s Institute of Popular Music, which is also the repository for the Association's archived materials.{{Cite web |url=http://www.iaspm.net/welcome/ |title=Welcome |website=IASPM website}} The ''Journal of Popular Music Studies'', published by the [[University of California Press]], is the official journal of the Association's United States branch (abbreviated '''IASPM-US''').{{Cite web |url=http://jpms.ucpress.edu/ |title=Homepage |website=Journal of Popular Music Studies website |language=en |access-date=2018-07-31}} == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * {{Official website|http://www.iaspm.net}} {{DEFAULTSORT:International Association for the Study of Popular Music}} [[Category:Musicology]] [[Category:Professional associations based in the United Kingdom|Study of Popular Music]] [[Category:Organizations established in 1981]] [[Category:International music organizations]] {{Music-org-stub}}

{{Infobox person | name= Kyaw Htet Aung | image =File:Kyaw Htet Aung.jpg | native_name = {{my|ကျော်ထက်အောင်}} | native_name_lang = my | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1985|09|14}} | birth_place = [[Yangon]], [[Myanmar]] | nationality = Burmese | occupation = [[Actor]], [[Model (person)|Model]], [[Television presenter|Television Host]] | alma_mater = [[East Yangon University]] | parents = Win Lwin
Myint Myint Oo |years_active = 2007-present (presenter, MC)
2016-present (acting) | website = {{URL|www.kyawhtetaung.com}} }} '''Kyaw Htet Aung''' ({{lang-my|ကျော်ထက်အောင်}}; born 14 September 1985) is a Burmese [[television host]], [[MC]], [[actor]] and [[Model (person)|model]]. He is best known for hosting in the televised singing competition show [[Myanmar Idol]], which propelled him to fame in [[Myanmar]].{{cite web|url=http://www.moda.com.mm/articles/sitppmeka-nmken-anapaaaupalmekaep-pnleakwilaete-asiastku-ekakeaa|title=စိတ်ဆန္ဒပြင်းပြမှုကြောင့် ၀န်ထမ်းဘဝကနေ ၀ါသနာပါရာအနုပညာလမ်းကြောင်းပေါ် ပြန်လည်ရောက်ရှိလာခဲ့တဲ့ အစီအစဉ်တင်ဆက်သူ ကျော်ထက်အောင်|work=Moda Magazine|date=22 June 2017|accessdate=29 June 2018|language=my|author=Moe Thsndar Lwin}}{{cite news|url=http://yangonlife.com.mm/en/article/kyaw-htet-aung-wants-surprise-fans-dance-moves|title=Kyaw Htet Aung wants to surprise fans with dance moves|publisher=Yangon Life|date=3 January 2018|accessdate=29 June 2018|language=}}{{cite news|url=https://burma.irrawaddy.com/lifestyle/entertainment/2018/05/11/158321.html|title=ဒီနေ့အထိ မနက်စာဝယ်ကျွေးတာက အစ အမေပါပဲ လို့ဆိုလာတဲ့ ကျော်ထက်အောင်|publisher=[[The Irrawaddy]]|date=11 May 2018|accessdate=28 June 2018|author=Mann Thu|language=my}}{{cite news|url=http://www.mizzimaburmese.com/article/27667|title=ပရိသတ်ကို SURPRISE လုပ်ရတာ အကြိုက်ဆုံးပဲ (ကျော်ထက်အောင်)|publisher=[[Mizzima]]|date=6 February 2017|accessdate=29 June 2018|language=my}} ==Early life and education== Kyaw Htet Aung was born on 14 September 1985 in [[Yangon]], Myanmar to parent Win Lwin and Myint Myint Oo. He graduated from [[East Yangon University]]. He studied acting at Talents & Models Agency in 2000.{{cite news|url=http://yangonlife.com.mm/en/article/birthday-donation-kyaw-htet-aung|title=Birthday Donation of Kyaw Htet Aung|publisher=Yangon Life|date=25 September 2018|accessdate=29 June 2018|language=}} ==Career== ===MC and Host=== Kyaw has been started his career as presenter since 2007s. He is the second generation of the first young TV presenters and worked as a host for Family Entertainment from 2010 to 2014. After that, he started as a freelance model and MC. He has been TV host for many talk show programs and received acceptance of audience for famous reality show [[Myanmar Idol]].{{cite news|url=http://7daydaily.com/story/107952|title=မြန်မာအိုင်ဒေါအစီအစဉ်မှာ ဆန်းသစ်မှုတွေနဲ့ မြင်ရမယ့် ကျော်ထက်အောင်|publisher=[[7Day News]]|date=|accessdate=29 June 2018|author=Khin Swe Thet|language=my}}{{cite news|url=http://www.myawady.net.mm/index.php/arts/item/24331-2018-06-03-09-42-55|title=သရုပ်ဆောင်ရာမှာ စကားပြောခန်းတွေကို သတိထားရတယ် ဆိုတဲ့ ကျော်ထက်အောင်|publisher=[[Myawaddy TV]]|date=3 June 2018|accessdate=29 June 2018|language=my}} He make TV host for [[Myanmar Motion Picture Academy Awards|Myanmar Motion Picture Academy Awards Ceremony]] 2016 and 2017 and also host at [[Miss Universe Myanmar]] 2018.{{cite news|url=http://burma.irrawaddy.com/lifestyle/2016/04/04/111814.html|title=နိုင်ငံအဆင့် ပွဲအခမ်းအနားမှာ ပထမဆုံး အခမ်းအနားမှူး လုပ်ခွင့်ရတဲ့ ကျော်ထက်အောင်|publisher=[[The Irrawaddy]]|date=4 April 2016|accessdate=29 June 2018|language=my}} ===Acting caeer=== Kyaw entered the entertainment industry, he has been practicing dance choreography on a regular basis. He is set to star in a short film project, sponsored by Myanmar Brewery. As he would play the role of a dancer for the first time, he is now practicing dance moves with the “''Secret Pieces Dance Crew''”. Rising to fame in 2016, he became a professional actor.{{cite news|url=http://yangonlife.com.mm/mm/article/19889|title=မရှိတဲ့ စိတ်ဓါတ်တွေပါ ကျခဲ့ရတယ်ဆိုတဲ့ ကျော်ထက်အောင်|publisher=Yangon Life|date=25 June 2018|accessdate=29 June 2018|language=my}}{{cite news|url=http://www.7daydaily.com/story/72688|title=သရုပ်ဆောင်လုပ်တော့မယ့် Myanmar Idol တင်ဆက်သူ ကျော်ထက်အောင်|publisher=[[7Day News|7Day Daily]]|date=13 August 2016|accessdate=29 June 2018|author=Zwe Nyan|language=my}} He started his debut acting career as a supporting role in 2016 big screen movie, ''Kyat Gu'' (Coffin Cave), directed by [[Lu Min (actor)|Lu Min]], and which showing in Myanmar cinemas on 2018. He was working and signed under Aung Khit Minn Film Production.{{cite news|url=https://burma.irrawaddy.com/lifestyle/2016/06/23/116946.html|title=ရုပ်ရှင်မှာ စတင် သရုပ်ဆောင်တဲ့ အခမ်းအနားမှူး ကျော်ထက်အောင်|publisher=[[The Irrawaddy]]|date=23 June 2016|author=Yu Mon Kyaw|accessdate=29 June 2018|language=my}} He debut lead role big screen movie was "''Thu Nge'' " (Burmese:သူငယ်), together with Yan Aung, Ye Aung, Min Oo, Soe Myat Thuzar, [[Htun Eaindra Bo]], [[Khine Thin Kyi]] and Mari Ko, directed by Arr Yone Oo Pwint Thingi Zaw, and the movie which will be showing in Myanmar cinemas in 23 June 2017. In the same year, he start acting role as ''Nyein Chan'' in his 2nd big screen movie "''Nay Chi Mhar Shwe Yi Laung'' ", alongside with actress Aye Myat Thu, Nan Myat Phyo Than. The movie was directed by Zaw Myint Oo, and which showing in Myanmar cinemas on 15 September 2017 and nominated as [[Myanmar Motion Picture Academy Awards|Myanmar Academy Awards]] "Best Actor" to Kyaw Htet Aung.{{cite news|url=http://www.mizzimaburmese.com/article/31572|title=နေခြည်မှာ ရွှေရည်လောင်း ရုပ်ရှင်ဇာတ်ကား မြန်မာတစ်နိုင်ငံရှိ အဆင့်မြင့် ရုပ်ရှင်ရုံများတွင် ပြသတော့မည်|publisher=[[Mizzima]]|date=9 April 2017|author=Pan Myat Zaw|accessdate=29 June 2018|language=my}}{{cite news|url=http://www.7daydaily.com/story/97804|title=ကျောင်းဆရာဇာတ်ရုပ်အတွက် လက်ပေါ်က တက်တူးဖျက်ပစ်လိုက်တဲ့ ကျော်ထက်အောင်|publisher=[[7Day News]]|date=2 June 2017|author=Zwe Nyan|accessdate=29 June 2018|language=my}} In 2018, He starring role as a military doctor in the military figures film “''Sit Ko Mone Ywae Tite Khae Ti'' ” was base on true story and film which showing and aired on [[Myawaddy TV|Myawaddy Channel]] in 25 March 2018. In the same year, he has starring as lead role in big screen movie "''Za Yike'' ", with actor [[Lu Min (actor)|Lu Min]], actress [[Khine Thin Kyi]] and [[Htun Eaindra Bo]], the movie which will be showing in Myanmar cinemas on soon.{{cite news|url=http://www.popularmyanmar.com/2017/09/25/ပရိသတ္ေတြကို-အလုပ္ေတြနဲ/|title=ပရ်သတ်တွေကို အလုပ်တွေနဲ့ပဲ သတ်သေပြမဲ့ ကျော်ထက်အောင်|publisher=Popular Journal|date=|accessdate=29 June 2018|language=my}} And also starring in big screen movie "''Carbon Dioxide'' ", with actor Alinn Young, actress [[Phway Phway]] and Yadabar Bo, directed by [[Wyne (film director)|Wyne]], and which showing in Myanmar cinemas on 27 July 2018. He starring in big screen movie "''Chu Si'' ", and then shooting movie "''The Masks'' " on May 6, 2018.{{cite news|url=http://www.7daydaily.com/story/121846|title='မျက်နှာဖုံးများ' ဇာတ်ကားမှာ မင်းသားဇာတ်ရုပ် သရုပ်ဆောင်မယ့် ကျော်ထက်အောင်|publisher=[[7Day News]]|date=6 March 2018|accessdate=29 June 2018|author=Khin Swe Thet|language=my}} ===Advertising=== Kyaw Htet Aung was appointed as brand ambassador of [[Red Bull]] and [[Nescafé]] in 2017 and also brand ambassador of Nutrivita in 2018. ==Filmography== ===Film (Big Screen Movies)=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Lists of Films |- ! Year ! Film ! Director ! Co-Stars ! Role ! Notes |- |2017 |Thu Nge |Ahar Yone Oo Pwint Thingi Zaw |Yan Aung, Ye Aung, Min Oo, Soe Myat Thuzar, [[Htun Eaindra Bo]], [[Khine Thin Kyi]], Mari Ko |Shane | |- |2017 |Nay Chi Mhar Shwe Yi Laung |Zaw Myint Oo |Aye Myat Thu, Kyaw Kyaw, Nann Myat Phyo Thin |Nyein Chan |Nominated - Academy Award for Best Actor |- |2018 |Sit Ko Mone Ywae Tite Khae Ti |Tin Aung Soe (Pan Myo Taw) |Htoo Aung, Nay Min, Ei Chaw Po, Soe Myat Thuzar, Soe Myat Nandar, [[Soe Pyae Thazin]], Thun Sett |Military doctor | |- |2018 |Za Yike |Aw Yatha |[[Lu Min (actor)|Lu Min]], [[Khine Thin Kyi]], [[Htun Eaindra Bo]] |Tin Maung Win | |- |2018 |Carbon Dioxide |[[Wyne (film director)|Wyne]] |Alinn Young, [[Phway Phway]], Thandar Bo |? | |- |2018 |Chu Si |Academy Min Oo |Melody, Aye Myat Thu, Ei Chaw Po, May, Nann Su Oo |? | |- |2018 |The Masks |Academy Min Oo |Min Oo, Ei Chaw Po, [[Aye Wutyi Thaung]], [[Soe Pyae Thazin]] |? | |- |2018 |Kyat Gu |[[Lu Min (actor)|Lu Min]] |Myint Myat, [[Lu Min (actor)|Lu Min]], [[Htun Eaindra Bo]], [[Eaindra Kyaw Zin]] |Saw Wai Oo (school teacher) |supporting role |} == References == {{reflist|2}} ==External links== *{{Facebook|100011650710307}} *{{instagram|kendrickkha_aung|Kyaw Htet Aung}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kyaw Htet Aung}} [[Category:1985 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Burmese film actors]] [[Category:21st-century Burmese male actors]] [[Category:Masters of Ceremonies]] [[Category:Television presenters]] [[Category:Burmese male models]] [[Category:People from Yangon]]

{{Expand French|date=August 2017|La Femis}} {{Infobox university |name = École Nationale Supérieure des Métiers de l'Image et du Son |latin_name = |image = La Fémis logo.svg |motto = |mottoeng = |athletics_motto = |established = 1943 (IDHEC), 1986 (La Fémis) |type = [[Grande école]] |endowment = |staff = 650 |faculty = |president = [[Raoul Peck]] |director = Nathalie Coste-Cerdan |provost = |head_label = |head = |students = |undergrad = |postgrad = 200 |other = 30 |city = [[Paris, France|Paris]] |state = [[Île-de-France (region)|Île-de-France]] |country = [[France]] |coor={{coord|48.8904|2.3426|type:edu_region:FR|display=inline,title}} |campus = [[Urban area|Urban]]
[[Pathé | Pathé Studios]] |nickname = La Fémis |colors= |athletics = |mascot = |fightsong = |free_label = |free = |affiliations = [[Paris Sciences et Lettres – Quartier latin|PSL Research University]]
[[CILECT]]
[[Minister of Culture (France)|Minister of Culture of France]] |nobel_laureates = |address = 6 rue Francoeur, 75018 Paris, France |website = |logo = }} '''La Fémis''' (French: ''École Nationale Supérieure des Métiers de l'Image et du Son'', formerly known as the ''[[Institut des hautes études cinématographiques]]'', IDHEC), is the film and television school of [[PSL Research University]]. ''FEMIS'' is an [[acronym]] for ''Fondation Européenne pour les Métiers de l’Image et du Son''. Based in [[Paris]], it offers courses balanced between artistic research, professional development and technical training. In 2012, [[The Hollywood Reporter]] rated La fémis no.6 in its best international film school rankings (it included U.S.-based film schools) and no.3 in its 2014 best international film school rankings (it excluded U.S.-based film schools).[http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/gallery/thrs-top-25-film-schools-354506#6-la-femis http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/gallery/thrs-top-25-film-schools-354506#6-la-femis] hollywoodreporter.comhttp://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/study-top-15-international-film-721648 Its alumni have won three of the world's most prestigious film prizes - [[Cannes Film Festival]]'s [[Golden Palm]], [[Venice Film Festival]]'s [[Golden Lion]] and [[Berlin International Film Festival]]'s [[Golden Bear]] - ten times, making it the most rewarded [[film school]] in the world, preceding the [[Beijing Film Academy]] and the [[Tisch School of the Arts]] of [[New York City]], in winning those three prizes. ==History== [[File:Exterior Pathé-Fémis.JPG|thumb|left|290px|La Fémis]] From 1944 to 1985, the [[IDHEC]] ([[Institut des hautes études cinématographiques]]) was the main French film school — training 1,439 French and foreign film professionals. In 1985, the school was restructured under the supervision of the then [[Minister of Culture (France)|Minister of Culture]] [[Jack Lang (French politician)|Jack Lang]] and La Fémis was created in 1986. Originally, scriptwriter [[Jean-Claude Carrière]] was its president and [[Jack Gajos]] was its director. When La Fémis was created, the school had seven teaching departments: direction, screenwriting, picture, sound, editing, production, and set design. A script continuity course was added in 1992 and a distribution/exploitation course in 2003. Lastly the master-class workshop, a European production training program, was co-created with the [[Filmakademie Baden-Württemberg]], Ludwigsburg, Germany in 2002. La Fémis is a full member of [[CILECT]], the international network of film schools. The school is now a public establishment under the responsibility of the Ministry of culture and communication. The school first opened in the [[Palais de Tokyo]] (Paris 16e), moving on February 15, 1999 to the old ''Rapid Film'' - [[Pathé]] Studios at 6, rue Francoeur (18e). Their founder and French prime class producer [[Bernard Natan]] was deported by the Nazis 1942. ==Curriculum== [[File:Plateau Fémis.JPG|thumb|upright|270px|La Femis (film set 1)]] The main curriculum students follow a four-year training course. During the first year, they all follow the same general course: initiation into the various jobs involved in filmmaking, experimenting in every technical position within a film crew. During the second and third year, they follow a specific curriculum depending on the department they have chosen, including theoretical classes, exercises, days devoted to film analysis, analytical seminars and collective exercises making films. They spend their fourth year fulfilling an individual end-of-studies project (known as "travail de fin d'études" or TFE) and taking part in their classmates' projects. In sum, the school is designed to foster an applied cinephilia, in which the study of films past and present underwrites advanced skills in the practicalities of filmmaking; returning alumni, like Jean Paul Civeyrac, who come back to themselves lead seminars, carry on this tradition of encouraging advanced auteurist ambitions among the new students.Palmer, Tim (2011). Brutal Intimacy: Analyzing Contemporary French Cinema, Wesleyan University Press, Middleton CT. {{ISBN|0-8195-6827-9}}. The school is the subject of a 2016 French film called ''Le Concours (The Graduation)'', directed by Claire Simon about the exhaustive application process to be accepted as a student. ==Alumni== La Fémis has trained over 700 students in all filmmaking trades: directors, screenwriters, producers, editors, cameramen, sound engineers, decorators, script supervisors, distributors and exhibition managers/executives. Among them: ''(in alphabetical order)'' {{col-begin}}{{col-2}} *[[Omar Amiralay]] *[[Theo Angelopoulos]] *[[Jean-Jacques Annaud]] *[[Hélène Angel]] *[[Solveig Anspach]] *[[Emmanuelle Bercot]] *[[Yves Boisset]] *[[Céline Bozon]] *[[Christine Carrière]] *[[Yves Caumont]] *[[Alain Cavalier]] *[[Renaud Cohen]] *[[Henri Colpi]] *[[Antony Cordier]] *[[Alain Corneau]] *[[Jean-Paul Civeyrac]] *[[Alfonso Gumucio Dagron]] *[[Marina de Van]] *[[Claire Denis]] *[[Arnaud Desplechin]] *[[Robert Enrico]] *[[Pascale Ferran]] *[[Sophie Fillières]] *[[Christophe Gans]] *[[Costa Gavras]] {{col-2}} *[[Delphine Gleize]] *[[Marc-Djibril Glissant]] *[[Ruy Guerra]] *[[Johan van der Keuken]] *[[Jean L'Hôte]] *[[Patrice Leconte]] *[[Noémie Lvovsky]] *[[Laetitia Masson]] *[[Louis Malle]] *[[Claude Miller]] *[[Orso Miret]] *[[Emmanuel Mouret]] *[[François Ozon]] *[[Manuel Pradal]] *[[Alain Resnais]] *[[Éric Rochant]] *[[Paulo Rocha (film director)|Paulo Rocha]] *[[Am Rong]] *[[Claude Sautet]] *[[Céline Sciamma]] *[[Partho Sen-Gupta]] *[[André Téchiné]] *[[Eskil Vogt]] *[[Hu Wei (director)|Hu Wei]] *[[Andrzej Żuławski]] {{col-end}} ==External links== * {{fr}} [http://www.femis.fr/ La Fémis] ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Fémis, La}} [[Category:Film schools in France]] [[Category:Educational institutions established in 1944]] [[Category:Culture of Paris]] [[Category:Education in Paris]] [[Category:Cinema of France]] [[Category:European cinema]] [[Category:Media in Paris]] [[Category:1944 establishments in France]]

revision.comment: link [[A Modest Proposal]] using [[:en:User:Edward/Find link|Find link]]
revision.text:
A '''loose sentence''' (also called a cumulative sentence) is a type of sentence in which the main idea ([[Clause#Independent and dependent clauses|independent clause]]) is elaborated by the successive addition of modifying clauses or phrases.
==Construction==
It adds modifying elements after the subject, complement, and verb.
==Effect==
Loose sentences may make a work seem informal, relaxed, and conversational. However, according to Strunk and White's ''[[The Elements of Style]]'' (2000), a succession of loose sentences, especially those of two clauses, is to be avoided because of "mechanical symmetry and sing-song". <ref>{{Cite web | url = http://www.tulane.edu/~umar365/readings/elements6.htm | title = Elements of Style | website = www.tulane.edu | access-date = 2016-02-29 }}</ref>
==Examples==
* "Bells rang, filling the air with their clangor, startling pigeons into flight from every belfry, bringing people into the streets to hear the news." (From the English Reviewer) * She drove her car to go to the movies, and got gas. * "I have been assured by a very knowing American friend of my acquaintance in London, that a young healthy child well nourished is at a year old a most delicious, nourishing, and wholesome food, whether stewed, roasted, baked or boiled; and I make no doubt it will equally serve in a fricassee or a ragout." Jonathan Swift, [[A Modest Proposal]]
== Alternatives == If the writer finds that he has written a series of sentences of the type described, he should recast enough of them to remove the monotony, replacing them by simple sentences, by sentences of two clauses joined by a semicolon, by periodic sentences of two clauses, by sentences, loose or periodic, of three clauses—whichever best represent the real relations of the thought.<ref>{{cite book|last1=Strunk Jr.|first1=William|title=The Elements of Style|date=July 28, 2009|publisher=W L C|isbn=1557427283}}</ref>
For example, if the writer wanted to rewrite the above examples he could write: * Bells rang. Their resonance filled the air with clangor, startling pigeons into flight from every belfry. Upon hearing the sounds, the townspeople rushed into the streets. They all stood in silence and awaited the news. * She drove to the movies. Afterwards she went to the gas station to fill up.
== See also == * [[The Elements of Style|Elements of Style]]
== References == {{Reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Loose Sentence}} [[Category:Grammar]] [[Category:Rhetoric]]

{{short description|Argentine television series}} {{Infobox television | show_name = Los únicos | image = Los unicos.jpg | caption = | show_name_2 = | genre = superhero live-action television series | creator = [[Adrián Suar]] | developer = [[Pol-ka]] | writer = Pablo Junovich
Cecilia Guerty
[[Mariano Vera]] | director = Rodolfo Antúnez
Sebastián Pivotto | creative_director = Liza Gieco | presenter = | starring = [[Mariano Martínez (actor)|Mariano Martínez]] [[Nicolás Cabré]] [[Griselda Siciliani]] [[Nicolás Vázquez]] [[Claudia Fontán]] [[Jimena Barón]] [[Arnaldo André]] [[Brenda Asnicar]] [[María Eugenia Suárez]] [[Marco Antonio Caponi]] [[Rodrigo Noya]] [[Elías Viñoles]] [[Gimena Accardi]] [[Darío Lopilato]] [[Emilia Attías]] Eugenia Tobal José María Monje Marcelo Mazzarello Victorio D'Alessandro Christian Sancho Juan Manuel Guilera | judges = | voices = | narrated = | theme_music_composer = | opentheme = ''Los Únicos''
Octavio Stampalia | composer = | country = [[Argentina]] | language = [[Spanish language]] | num_seasons = 2 | num_episodes = 243 | list_episodes = | executive_producer = [[Adrián Suar]] | producer = | editor = | location = | cinematography = | camera = | runtime = 60 minutes | company = | distributor = | channel = [[Canal 13 (Argentina)|El Trece]] | picture_format = | audio_format = | first_run = | first_aired = February 7, 2011 | last_aired = May 11, 2012 | status = | preceded_by = ''[[Alguien que me quiera]]'' | followed_by = ''[[Solamente Vos]] | related = [[Sin Código]] | website = http://www.eltrecetv.com.ar/programa/los-unicos | website_title = | production_website = }} '''''Los únicos''''' ({{lang-es|"The uniques"}}) is a 2011 Argentine superhero live-action television series aired by [[Canal 13 (Argentina)|El Trece]] in the [[prime time]]. The "uniques" are a superhero team working as a [[covert operation]] unit. Main actors are [[Arnaldo André]], [[Mariano Martínez (actor)|Mariano Martínez]] and [[Griselda Siciliani]], the two main supervillains are played by [[Favio Posca]] and [[Carlos Belloso]]. ==Premise== Unlike most productions by Pol-ka, ''Los únicos'' is not a telenovela featuring common people or a vengeance plot.{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1348381-los-unicos |title= Los únicos |first= Marcelo |last= Stiletano |date= 09/02/2011 |publisher= [[La Nación]] |location= [[Buenos Aires]] |language= Spanish |trans-title=The uniques}} Instead, it is a crime fiction comedy with [[metafiction]]al elements. As such, it avoids the usual constrains of the plots of the aforementioned genres. The plot is influenced by the [[X-Men (film series)|''X-Men'' film series]], ''[[Heroes (U.S. TV series)|Heroes]]'' and ''[[Sky High (2005 film)|Sky High]]''. Nicolás Cabré makes a [[Spin-off (media)|spin-off]] of the ''[[Sin Código]]'' telenovela, playing again his former character of "Axel Etcheverry". In the new plot, the "Nielsen Security" group has gone bankrupt, and Axel blames his former teammate Gabriel Nielsen for it. Nielsen (which was played by [[Adrián Suar]], creator of both series) has appeared a number of times, as well as other characters and references to the former telenovela. [[Arnaldo André]] composed his character, an experimented leader managing a team, based over his own protective relations with relatives, and the ways TV producers try to motivate him to accept a work. He made a deliberate effort to avoid giving an authoritarian style to the character, to avoid comparisons with his former character at ''[[Valientes]]''.{{cite interview |last= André|first= Arnaldo |subjectlink= Arnaldo André|interviewer= Adriana Schettini |title= Arnaldo André: "La televisión me dio todo, todo, todo" |location= [[Buenos Aires]] |date= 2011-02-18 |work= [[Clarín (Argentine newspaper)|Clarín espectáculos]]|accessdate=2011-03-31}} ==Production== The series has had cameos from notable Argentine actors, such as [[Esteban Prol]],{{cite web |url= http://www.clarin.com/espectaculos/television-y-radio/Esteban-Prol-suma-unicos_0_447555480.html |title= Esteban Prol se suma a "Los únicos" |date= 2011-03-20 |publisher= [[Clarín (Argentine newspaper)|Clarín Espectáculos]] |location= [[Buenos Aires]] |language= Spanish |trans-title=Esteban Prol join "The uniques" |accessdate= 2011-03-31}} [[Eugenia Suárez]], [[Carlos Baute]] and [[Anabela Ascar]].{{cite web |url= http://teleshow.infobae.com/notas/572446-Mas-invitados-especiales-para-Los-Unicos |title= Más invitados especiales para Los únicos |date= 2011-03-31 |publisher= Teleshow |location= [[Buenos Aires]] |language= Spanish |trans-title=More special guests for "The uniques" |accessdate= 2011-03-31}} [[Gonzalo Heredia]], from the previous successful telenovela ''[[Malparida]]'', played himself in a casual scene,{{cite web |url= http://www.clarin.com/espectaculos/television-y-radio/horario_0_445755448.html |title= Este horario es mío |date= 2011-03-17 |publisher= [[Clarín (Argentine newspaper)|Clarín Espectáculos]] |location= [[Buenos Aires]] |language= Spanish |trans-title=This hour is mine |accessdate= 2011-03-31}} with a brief cameo of [[Juana Viale]], also from that telenovela.{{cite web |url= http://www.clarin.com/espectaculos/television-y-radio/inadvertido-cameo-estrella-Unicos_0_445155701.html |title= Casi inadvertido, el "cameo" de una estrella en "Los Unicos" |date= 2011-03-16 |publisher= [[Clarín (Argentine newspaper)|Clarín Espectáculos]] |location= [[Buenos Aires]] |language= Spanish |trans-title=Almost unnoticed, the "cameo" of a star in "The uniques" |accessdate= 2011-03-31}} [[Osvaldo Laport]] will play again his former character of "Amador Heredia" from ''[[Soy Gitano]]''. [[Miguel Ángel Rodríguez]] and [[Martín Bossi]] will play crime bosses, and [[Ana María Orozco]] will join the team. A [[fashion show]] will include the presence of [[Pía Slapka]], acting as herself, and fashion designer [[Roberto Giordano]]. The series had a successful rating, with nearly 20 points.{{cite web |url= http://www.clarin.com/espectaculos/television-y-radio/Primero-ficcion_0_446355395.html |title= Primero, la ficción |date= 2011-03-17 |publisher= [[Clarín (Argentine newspaper)|Clarín Espectáculos]] |location= [[Buenos Aires]] |language= Spanish |trans-title=First, fiction |accessdate= 2011-03-31}}{{cite web |url=http://www.clarin.com/espectaculos/television-y-radio/Unicos-sigue-marcando-tendencia_0_446355625.html |title= "Los Unicos" sigue marcando tendencia |date= 2011-03-18 |publisher= [[Clarín (Argentine newspaper)|Clarín Espectáculos]] |location= [[Buenos Aires]] |language= Spanish |trans-title="The uniques" keeps marking trends |accessdate= 2011-03-31}} ==Plot== The "Uniques" are actually one of several [[covert operation]] units of skilled or superpowered people working at different countries. Alfredo Monterrey organized many of those units, and the series is about the creation and organization of the Argentine branch. His recruits are Diego Rouvier, Axel Etcheverry, María Soledad Marini, Rubén Hagi, Rosario Ahumada, Violeta Morano and Hugo Albarracín. María has [[superhuman strength]], Axel has an unbreakable [[Human skeleton|skeleton]], Rubén Hagi has indestructible skin, and Violeta Morano is [[precognition|precognitive]]. Diego and Rosario have no superhuman powers: Diego is a skilled secret agent, and Rosario a former burglar with a taste for high-stake thefts. The team is opposed by the villains Livio Muzak and Ronco Milevich. Ronco is capable of electric manipulation. ==Cast== * [[Mariano Martínez (actor)|Mariano Martínez]] as Diego Rouvier * [[Nicolás Cabré]] as Axel Etcheverry * [[Griselda Siciliani]] as María Soledad Marini * [[Nicolás Vázquez]] as Ruben Hagi * Eugenia Tobal as Rosario Ahumada * [[Brenda Asnicar]] as Keira Beltrán * Marcelo Mazzarello as Adolfo Fortuna * José María Monje as Hugo Albarracín * [[María Eugenia Suárez]] as Sofía Reyes * [[Jimena Barón]] as María Paula Said * [[Claudia Fontán]] as Soraya Bismarck * [[Arnaldo André]] as Alfredo Monterrey * [[Rodrigo Noya]] as Bruno Epstein * Juan Manuel Guilera as Lucas Miller * Victorio D'Alessandro as Ciro Fuentes * [[Julieta Zylberberg]] as Helena Epstein * Pilar Gamboa as Violeta Morano † * Marina Bellati as Melania * Leo Kreimer as "Zurdo" * Ana María Castel as Elvira * Fabián Arenillas as Manuel Soria * [[Carlos Belloso]] as Livio Muzak † * Favio Posca as Ronco Milevich * Fabián Gianola as Dreyfus * Martín Bossi as Patrón Carranza * [[Tomás Fonzi]] as Joaquín Ferragut † * [[Daniel Hendler]] as Wilson Castro † * [[Emilio Disi]] as Américo ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.eltrecetv.com.ar/programa/los-unicos Official site] {{es}} * {{IMDb title|1729622}} {{Pol-ka}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Unicos, los}} [[Category:2010s Argentine television series]] [[Category:2011 telenovelas]] [[Category:2011 Argentine television series debuts]] [[Category:2012 Argentine television series endings]] [[Category:Superhero comedy television series]] [[Category:Spanish-language telenovelas]] [[Category:Sequel television series]] [[Category:Pol-ka telenovelas]]

{{for|the founder of ''Texas Monthly'' magazine|Michael R. Levy}} {{EngvarB|date=August 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2014}} {{Infobox Politician | honorific-prefix = [[The Right Honourable]] | name = The Lord Levy | honorific-suffix = | image = | imagesize = | caption = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1944|07|11}} | birth_place = | spouse = Gilda | children = 2 | office = | term_start = | term_end = | monarch = | primeminister = | predecessor = | successor = | party = [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour]] | religion = [[Judaism]] }}
'''Michael Abraham Levy, Baron Levy''', (born 11 July 1944) was a practising Chartered Accountant and Chairman & CEO of a large independent group of music companies, and is a Labour Peer.
He is the President of Volunteering Matters, Jewish Care, Jewish Free School (JFS) and Jewish Lads' and Girls' Brigade (JLGB).
Levy was the chief fundraiser for the UK Labour Party. A long-standing friend of former Prime Minister, [[Tony Blair]], Lord Levy spent nine years as Tony Blair's special envoy to the Middle East,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/6929458.stm |title=UK appoints new Middle East envoy |publisher=BBC News |date=3 August 2007}}</ref> being replaced by Gordon Brown's appointee, [[Michael Williams, Baron Williams of Baglan|Lord Williams of Baglan]], from September 2007.
==Early life== Born in [[Stoke Newington]], [[North London]], to devout Jewish immigrant parents of modest means, Levy was educated at Grocers, later known as [[Hackney Downs School]].<ref name=bagman />
==Music career== Levy qualified as a Chartered Accountant in 1966 (ACA then FCA) and set up a very successful professional accountancy practice.
The practice attracted a great number of clients in the music and entertainment industry and Levy became a specialist in international copyright and licence.
Amongst the clients were [[the Foundations]], Vanity Fair, Roger Greenaway, Barry Mason and many other successful producers and artists.
Levy founded [[Magnet Records]] with [[Peter Shelley]] in 1973.<ref name="Sweeting">Adam Sweeting [https://www.theguardian.com/music/2014/oct/23/alvin-stardust "Alvin Stardust obituary"], ''The Guardian'', 23 October 2014</ref> This became one of the most successful independent labels of its day and at one stage had 10% of the British singles market with four singles in the top ten.
The successful artists on the label included [[Adrian Baker]], [[Alvin Stardust]], [[Chris Rea]], [[Bad Manners]], Darts, Susan Cadogan, Silver Convention and [[Guys 'n' Dolls]].
Levy sold Magnet Records to [[Warner Brothers]] in 1988 for [[Pound Sterling|£]]10[[million|m]].
Guitarist Chris Rea said of Levy, "He is extremely tough, one of the hardest bastards I have ever met, but I would leave my children with him rather than anyone else." The [[record producer|music producer]] [[Pete Waterman]] described him as "the greatest salesman I have ever met. He would be able to sell sand to the Arabs."<ref name=bagman />
After Magnet was sold, Levy set up [[M&G Records]] with backing from [[Polygram Records|Polygram]]. [[M&G Records]] was so named as it was the initials of Michael and his wife Gilda, and featured acts such as [[Zoë (British singer)|Zoe]] who had a top five hit with "Sunshine on a Rainy Day" and [[Pele (English band)|Pele]] who had success with "Fair blows the wind for France". Polygram were then bought out and the company was eventually sold to Bertelsmann (BMG) in 1997.
==Aptitude for fundraising== Levy was involved in fundraising from his early life and from the late 1960s for many causes including Jewish and Israeli causes. For this he showed a special adeptness, raising, between 1988–1994, [[Pound Sterling|£]]60[[million|m]] for [[Jewish Care]], an amalgam of several Jewish charitable organisations, of which he is now President.<ref name=bagman /> Simon Morris, Chief Executive of Jewish Care, said of Levy that, when it comes to fundraising, "there's no one better in the country." Levy has been described as the number one fundraiser in the country.
==Political life== Levy first met Tony Blair at a dinner party in 1994, hosted by Israeli diplomat [[Gideon Meir]],<ref name=bagman>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2006/mar/19/constitution.partyfunding | title=There was once a jolly bagman | author=Euan Ferguson |publisher=The Observer |location=London |date=19 March 2006 |accessdate=19 January 2011}}</ref> the two having a common friend in [[Eldred Tabachnik]], a senior barrister (now a [[Queen's Counsel|QC]] and a former president of the [[Board of Deputies of British Jews]]) at [[11 King's Bench Walk Chambers|11 King's Bench Walk]], the chambers founded by [[Derry Irvine, Baron Irvine of Lairg|Derry Irvine]] where Blair had trained in the early 1980s.<ref name="magic">{{cite news | url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/article/0,,2087-2092803,00.html | title=Lord Cashpoint's touch of money magic | publisher=Sunday Times | date=19 March 2006 | author=Stuart Wavell | location=London}}</ref> They soon became close friends and tennis partners. Levy ran the [[Labour Leader's Office Fund]] to finance Blair's campaign before the 1997 general election and received substantial contributions from such figures as [[Alex Bernstein]] and [[Robert Gavron]], both of whom were ennobled by Blair after he came to power. Levy himself was created a [[life peer]] on 23 September 1997 as '''Baron Levy''', of [[Mill Hill]] in the [[London Borough of Barnet]].<ref>{{London Gazette |issue=54904 |date=29 September 1997 |page=10969}}</ref> Since making his [[maiden speech]] on 3 December 1997, Levy has not spoken in a debate at the [[House of Lords]].
He has been described by ''[[The Jerusalem Post]]'' as "undoubtedly the notional leader of [[British Jewry]]".<ref name="magic" /> He was a founding member of the [[Jewish Leadership Council]], the leadership of UK Jewish community. Levy has close ties with Israeli political leaders. His son, [[Daniel Levy (political analyst)|Daniel Levy]], was active in Israeli political life, and has served as an assistant to the former Israeli Prime Minister [[Ehud Barak]] and to [[Knesset]] member [[Yossi Beilin]]. His son Daniel is now based in the UK and is now President of the US Middle East Project and before that was Head of the Middle East Department of the European Council of Foreign Relations. Levy has praised Blair for his "solid and committed support of the State of Israel"<ref>[http://www.jewishcare.org/events/ Jewish Care], Fundraising Dinner 2006</ref> and "his commitment to the peace process". Levy was associated with the [[Labour Friends of Israel]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Pierce, Andrew|url=|title=Blair's chance to raise cash for Pounds 1m refund|publisher=The Times|date=18 November 1997}}</ref>
Known as "Lord Cashpoint" to some in the media and politics,<ref name="magic" /> he was the leading fundraiser for the Labour Party from 1994 to 2007 (having raised over £100m for the Labour Party. In 2007 he voluntarily decided to step down at the same time as former Prime Minister Tony Blair.
In 2000, Levy was criticised when it was revealed that he had paid only £5,000 tax during the financial year 1998–1999<ref>{{cite news | title=Blair tycoon paid just £5,000 tax | publisher=Sunday Times | date=25 June 2000}}</ref> – however it was subsequently shown even in that year the tax paid was £30,000. In an interview at the time, repeated on BBC2's Newsnight on 16 March 2006, Levy stated that "Over the years I have paid many millions of tax and, if you average it, each year it comes to many hundreds of thousands of pounds. In that particular year, I was giving my time to the Labour Party and the voluntary sector, and I just lived off capital."<ref name="profile">{{cite news | url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/5173880.stm | title=Profile: Lord Levy | date=12 July 2006 | publisher=BBC}}</ref>
From 1998 until 2007, he acted as Prime Minister Blair's personal envoy to the Middle East.
Many leaders in the region including Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas have praised Levy for always offering constructive suggestions. Mr Blair has said Lord Levy carried out "a perfectly excellent job as my envoy under very difficult circumstances".
In September 2005, Levy was appointed President of the Council of the [[Specialist Schools and Academies Trust]], the body overseeing the government's [[Specialist school]]s and [[Academy (England)|Academy]] programmes.
===Cash for honours===
Levy was arrested and questioned in connection with the "[[Cash for Honours]]" inquiry by the [[Metropolitan Police]] on 12 July 2006 (whereby it was suggested that money was paid to political parties for Honours in particular peerages).<ref name=police1>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/5173860.stm |title=Top Labour fundraiser Levy bailed |publisher=BBC News | date=12 July 2006 |accessdate=19 January 2011}}</ref> No charges were made against Levy and the police removed all details from their files.
==Other positions==
Levy is President of [[Jewish Care]], the [[Jewish Free School]], [[Volunteering Matters]], [[Jewish Lads' and Girls' Brigade]] and Barnet & Southgate College.<ref name=lords-bio>{{cite web |url=http://www.parliament.uk/biographies/michael-levy/26917 |title=Lord Levy |publisher=House of Lords |accessdate=23 January 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101227131656/http://www.parliament.uk/biographies/michael-levy/26917 |archivedate=27 December 2010 |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref name="aide">{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/5196710.stm |title=MP probes award to Levy ex-aide |publisher=BBC |date=19 July 2006}}</ref> and the Honorary President of UJIA.
He is a Member of the World Board of Directors, The International Peace Institute, IPI (2014- ). He is a Member of the Advisory Council, Step Up to Serve Campaign (2013- ). He is the Chair of the Policy Network Foundation, a policy think tank. He also holds and has held a number of other positions in the voluntary sector.
In 2008 Levy became Chairman of International Standard Asset Management until 2011. Now Principal of Global Consultancy Services acting as a Consultant to a number of companies.<ref name=lords-bio />
==Personal life== He and his wife Gilda have a son, Daniel, and a daughter, Juliet.
Levy's home in [[Totteridge]], North London, was [[burglary|burgled]] in 2003. He and his wife Gilda were restrained with handcuffs and had bleach poured over them. Levy was hit on the head with a shovel and had his wrist broken; the attackers fled with £80,000 of cash and jewellery.<ref name="magic" />
Lord Levy received an Honorary Doctorate from Middlesex University in 1999, and the Israel Policy Forum (USA) Special Recognition Award in 2003. In 1994 he was a Recipient of the B'nai B'rith First Lodge Award and in 1998 a Recipient of the Friends of the Hebrew University of Jerusalem Scopus Award. He has received the Jewish Chronicle 175th Anniversary Award for outstanding, unique and long term contributions to British Community life.
Lord Levy's autobiography, ''A Question of Honour'', was published in 2008.<ref name=guardian-20080524>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/books/2008/may/24/biography.politics | title=Blinded by the light | author=Martin Bell |publisher=The Guardian |location=London |date=24 May 2008 |accessdate=23 January 2011}}</ref>
==Arms== {{Infobox COA wide |image = |image size = |notes = |year_adopted = |coronet = [[Coronet|Coronet of a Baron]] |escutcheon = Per pale Argent and Sable, five Bars counter-changed, over all three Trumpets bells upwards Or, a Chief engrailed of two arches Or. |supporters = On either side a Dove contourny and supporting with the wings addorsed and inverted Argent, beaked and legged Gules, holding in the beak a Sprig of Olive Or. |crest = A Dove Argent, beaked and legged Gules, the dexter wing expanded, inverted and supporting a Harp Or, in the beak a Sprig of Olive Or. |badge = |motto = |symbolism = }}

German [[intertitles]] | budget = | gross = | preceded_by = | followed_by = }} '''''Nameless Woman''''' (German: '''''Die Frau ohne Namen''''') is a 1927 German [[silent film|silent]] [[adventure film]] directed by [[ Georg Jacoby]] and starring [[ Elga Brink]], [[Jack Trevor]] and [[Georg Alexander]].Bock & Bergfelder p.223 It was released in two parts. A pair of American journalists embark on a world-wide tour in which they enjoy many adventures. It was shot in studios in [[Berlin]] and [[location filming|on location]] in the [[United States]] and [[East Asia]]. The film's sets were designed by [[Franz Schroedter]] and [[Hermann Warm]] . ==Cast== * [[ Elga Brink ]] as Violett Jeffrey * [[Jack Trevor ]] as Frank Milton * [[Georg Alexander ]] as Bobby Dix * [[Marietta Millner]] as Vivian Ried * [[Stewart Rome]] as Bareira * [[Georg Baselt ]] as Redakteur * [[Willi Schaeffers]] as Bürochef * [[Paul Biensfeldt]] as Konsul * [[Nien Soen Ling ]] as Der Chinese * [[Jakob Tiedtke]] as Ein reicher Koreaner * [[Magnus Stifter ]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==Bibliography== * Hans-Michael Bock and Tim Bergfelder. ''The Concise Cinegraph: An Encyclopedia of German Cinema''. Berghahn Books, 2009. ==External links== *{{IMDb title|0457352|Part I}} *{{IMDb title|0457353|Part II}} {{Georg Jacoby}} [[Category:1927 films]] [[Category:1920s adventure films]] [[Category:German adventure films]] [[Category:German films]] [[Category:Films of the Weimar Republic]] [[Category:German silent feature films]] [[Category:Films directed by Georg Jacoby]] [[Category:Chase films]] [[Category:Films about journalists]] [[Category:Films set in Arizona]] [[Category:Films set in China]] [[Category:Films set in Hawaii]] [[Category:Films set in Japan]] [[Category:Films set in San Francisco]] [[Category:Films set in the United States]] [[Category:German black-and-white films]] {{Germany-silent-film-stub}}
